document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

A2BA59C206AC4728AD7C65C2B1EEED54.description: Avoid plagiarism, giving credit to sources of information (title and author when available).

E82985107F8246AF83B12B0CB2253062.description: Organize and share information orally, in writing, or through visual display.

EDAA9951849C47B2B7F80BC4A8FE9791.description:
Organize evidence into relevant categories, recognizing that some sources may be more
reliable than others.

976B3F2F2A3C46E5BF8447F69ADA9625.description:
Locate information in reference texts, electronic resources, provided sources, or through
interviews and take brief notes on sources.

AE9946377AED4163ADAB84B600FF5704.description: Identify a topic and generate questions that explore the topic.

6DF196A950C347D0B4F21BC8D784FD24.description:
The student will conduct research and read or listen to a series of conceptually related
texts on selected topics to build knowledge on grade-three content and texts, solve problems
and support cross-curricular learning.

19F28F3CDF5A4D9DA5A564FB7DD954F8.description: **Standards that address Examining Media Messages begin in Grade Four.

CA93901528114AFAA5165D845C049C07.description:
Create a simple presentation using multimodal tools that enhance the topic and/or
presentation.

659BE4741ECB45C39860DF040B40C2EB.description:
Using language (formal or informal) and style as appropriate to audience, topic, and
purpose.

5FD847467C23452191BB84153291695D.description: Speaking audibly with appropriate pacing, prosody, and voice level.

4513D4A8C7A74F7588A6FEC10094E287.description: Using descriptive details and appropriate facts to support themes or central ideas.

1C05E1EF09B548289F2198CA4E040125.description:
Report orally on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in an organized
manner. This includes:

D6E84686C0944D10BE1ADC4C8E0FCDF6.description:
Asking and responding to questions that acquire or confirm information on a topic
and link their comments to the remarks of others.

FF34391E64EE4B7EB282AB9755093B82.description: Respectfully building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

B18055E6FD9B44D88357B7C510954E92.description: Listening actively and speaking using agreed-upon discussion rules.

3098FE5307C84523B5D65DA488AF3485.description:
Participate in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led)
on grade three topics and texts. This includes:

0F145977CD62485EA25256D53C48352A.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build a
community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

C090A5ECA6D94959948BFCB795519C9A.description: Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries to check and correct spelling.

46A4554058AB4D6AAA1D9538A5D86EF1.description:
Use learned spelling patterns when writing words, including high frequency words and
grade level word analysis knowledge.

45ECF3393F63446B9F5937E7D1C2AD0D.description: Use apostrophes to form contractions and frequently occurring possessions in writing.

2BEA16309E5E4620BBB2F85B082F8273.description: Use commas in series, dates, addresses, and in greetings and closings of letters.

68B370999299475596B9440E1AD389E5.description: Eliminate double negatives when speaking and writing.

2723CD8528C84D5E8A92EBB0FB282B46.description: Use subject-verb agreement in simple sentences.

4B8F56DFFE49444BBC34F7D8AAB10460.description: Form and use regular and irregular verbs when speaking and writing.

9BCB3EB148FB4B058089298C73640640.description: Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives when speaking and writing.

16F3B250F65A4D4FAF17E98E66B8C83F.description: Distinguish between complete and incomplete sentences.

A342BA940D844617A4FFD057BB7D1CB4.description:
Produce, expand, and rearrange simple and compound sentences when speaking and
writing.

22DF61BCCE0246069047B2CCFFDAD575.description:
The student will use the conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

E2A43E15284D4C18990791F77097508D.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, edit writing for format and conventions
such as capitalization, usage, punctuation, and spelling. (See Language Usage for gradelevel expectations).

749E82ADD9364F9C8FD65B2385331343.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as
needed by revising for quality of ideas, organization, sentence fluency, and word choice.

EDFF85A3369B43879106E1A49F7A7499.description: Using transition words to vary sentence structure.

73FD6E6235BD490CAE96E45260F22DB6.description: Elaborating writing by including supporting details.

C540715F03164FC9B525613767FED304.description:
Developing, selecting, and organizing ideas relevant to topic, audience,purpose, and
genre.

E1840994F8EC4CCDB9FCF5FE77F374C3.description: Writing a clear topic sentence focusing on a main idea.

363B185B12574957802A5004364081B1.description: Engage in writing as a process to compose a well-developed paragraph. This includes:

B4D38BC790074A77B7E768383AA4BA90.description:
Write in response to text(s) read or heard to share thinking using supporting details from
the text.

BD755E68B96A48C7BA05964D6FE4FA04.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with facts and reasons.

BBCC9F4C4BA045EEB67D89FEAEDEFE2F.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic that develops the topic with facts
and details.

8E6A56A5CB6E43BA8829034B9C8CBFF2.description: Write personal or fictional narratives that organize event sequences that unfold naturally.

7D0D3ABD5CB346658579BD1701BAAA02.description:
Recognize different forms of writing (narrative, expository, and opinion) have distinctive
patterns of organization to support their purpose.

F85D16D763FB4E89B802433C9A0434A7.description:
The student will compose various works for diverse audiences and purposes, linked to
grade three content and texts.

1077E432F70F426FB386D140718617EB.description:
Use phoneme/grapheme (sound/symbol) correspondences to encode (spell) grade-level
high-frequency words with automaticity and accuracy.

EE1C599697C043CFAAEDA8524E2A1B0F.description: Use common affixes to encode (spell) words.

B0847688E6994CE7A98AAB23F0D5DB28.description: Use phoneme-grapheme correspondence to encode (spell) multisyllabic words.

F2D35BAEBC2E40ACAC108055502BAFA2.description: Form cursive letters with flow from one letter to the next within names and words.

06B80408EEE74AC0AABC75BE6F4C51C9.description: Sign his/her first and last name.

E6EB068AA5BA4ABDA9EC16E7FA19F204.description: Write capital and lowercase letters of the alphabet using correct letter formation in cursive.

703F48BCAE3B471B8FF3AB4731FEBD18.description:
The student will print legibly in manuscript and cursive while applying grade level
word knowledge to spell words correctly.

2E139F414B624D20938888DC8DF15133.description: Demonstrate comprehension by writing about what is read using the text for support.

217E0716B2F84DCE92289730DDCF59F9.description:
Describe the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts,
or steps in technical procedures in a text.

73D6403EB8694FA1A111D220A0656452.description:
Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on
the same topic.

617BAAA6EAFC4DB3AC528FE0D7FEAF93.description: Use prior (experience) and background (content) knowledge as context for new learning.

F9639633433845BAA9BF818882B0829D.description:
Identify the author’s purpose for writing, including what the author wants to answer,
explain, or describe.

DFCFB5D377E1439180CCFB1CA7350342.description:
Use text features and search tools (e.g., sidebars, hyperlink) to locate and gain information
efficiently.

D3F24A48979741F8A41957E986BB6E9B.description:
Describe major structural differences between the organizational patterns of different
informational texts (e.g., cause/effect, comparison/contrast, problem/solution, description,
sequence, and chronological order) and how they support a reader’s understanding of the
text.

15C25B975787441282F3AAB9C622BD53.description:
Identify and explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support specific points in
texts.

7D0CA474C4BE435C92ABA2D5577F5E3B.description:
Summarize texts using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause and effect,
referring to historical events, scientific ideas, or steps in technical procedures.

23E19F05E3414074B29F1E2F1BF4CC20.description:
Determine the main idea of multi-paragraph texts as well as specific paragraphs within
them.

5651DAF55F7F4CF6BA29953E10C1A0E6.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from grade-level complex informational texts read.

DF8A7E0E332546E2BF4FD3FD5D38133A.description:
Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author
about the same or similar characters.

0EB271CC0B3F48FF83E117A77A29BC6D.description:
Compare and contrast details in paired literary and informational nonfiction texts including
their treatment of similar themes, topics, and patterns of events.

B6FAF13D868148E9980F942D9B3E4A26.description:
Set a purpose for reading by looking at the illustrations and activating prior (experience)
and background (content) knowledge.

BE4728E3FE8E42E08E877E9082DDAACE.description: Identify the characteristics of different genres.

26B4C299333F43F1AEB6BE6A9A937D2A.description: Identify the narrator of a story and the speaker of a poem.

BF7D253A4BA24F64A732FEB05FD122EB.description:
Identify and explain how an author uses sensory language (e.g., sights, sounds, smells, and
tastes) to impact a reader’s understanding of characters, settings, and plot events.

D20EE7A0A39943AEA5B5C41659C27862.description: Discuss how an author uses characters and settings to advance the plot.

2F622664235542A392759864889D4097.description:
Describe a character’s attributes, including their traits, motivations, or feelings and how
they develop throughout the text.

D281B4CA0FBF48AEB8CD8240BA1E17A7.description: Identify the central conflict and resolution using events from the plot to summarize the text.

3248BA5D9A4D4C53A1C56D68A7AF3E37.description:
Identify thematic topics of stories (e.g. friendship, survival, determination) and the lessons
learned.

D2314DBB4D814B3FAD7ED007E361687A.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of grade-level complex literary texts read to include fantasy,
humor, fable/fairy tale, realistic fiction, historical fiction, biography, autobiography, and
folklore/tall tale, with a focus on folklore and tall tales.

693CC2F15BA442638A6662E4F7809510.description: Use newly learned words and phrases in discussions and speaking activities.

916296199C29428DB9AD53722A6B27DB.description:
Use glossaries, beginning dictionaries and thesauruses, both print and digital, to determine
or clarify the meaning of words and phrases.

754893A26A344F01BCBC9D281BC871C8.description: Use strategies to infer word meanings.

20BC958650A540E0B2C752A0C2B37DA8.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs and adjectives.

C4D0865A8AE547D88E26642108F1F5C8.description:
Develop breadth of vocabulary knowledge by listening to and reading high quality,
complex text.

B95F36FB3E9349319E157E58FFE69783.description:
Apply knowledge of morphology, synonyms, and antonyms to determine the meaning of
complex words.

5C716993344F4D45AD3C9664D9ED36DC.description: Use the context of a sentence to apply knowledge of homophones.

FFE2230B212A48F293206BA6EA7D4F22.description:
Determine the meaning of complex words using frequently occurring root words and
inflectional affixes (e.g. -s, -ing, -ed).

7515DC935C4540319B36C343F3F3823A.description:
Discuss meanings of complex words and phrases acquired through conversations and
literature.

D4A4747169EC493F860AA668D977DFF4.description:
Develop general academic language and content specific vocabulary by listening to,
reading, and discussing a variety of texts relevant to a grade three topic or subject area.

4FAE2942214746D28EBE1F80E73D0B42.description: The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on gradethree content and texts read or heard.

3F8DDE9FCF14439AB89EFCE684F7CCEE.description:
Use reading strategies as needed to monitor comprehension when encountering challenging
sections of text. These sense-making strategies attended to common text organizational
structures, summarizing, asking questions of the text, and others (Reading Strategies, 3-
12).

B7EFCA9970E7405D8DE195781C3A47C3.description:
Regularly engage in listening to a series of conceptually related texts organized around
topics of study to build knowledge and vocabulary. Use background knowledge as context
for new learning (Deep Reading on Topics to Build Knowledge and Vocabulary K-12).

07596410044E4923AEF356E0D161C70D.description:
When responding to texts through discussions and/or writing, draw several pieces of
evidence from read alouds and grade-level complex texts to support claims, conclusions,
and inferences, including quoting or paraphrasing from texts accurately and tracing where
relevant evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

982F3F52F45C49DD87928F58273EF668.description:
Proficiently read and comprehend a variety of literary and informational texts that exhibit
complexity at the higher range of the grades 2-3 bands (See Quantitative and Qualitative
Analysis charts for determining complexity in the Appendix) (Text Complexity, 2-12).

DBA48912366243E091886F6E540EC150.description:
Read a variety of grade-level complex texts with accuracy, automaticity, appropriate rate,
and meaningful expression in successive readings to support comprehension. Monitor while reading to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, as necessary
(Reading Fluency, K-12).

EA442213E5F24DDDAABB2D8371EEF0B7.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading and
listening to a range of challenging, content-rich texts. This includes fluently reading and
gathering evidence from grade-level complex texts and reading widely on topics to gain
purposeful knowledge and vocabulary, and using reading strategies when comprehension
breaks down.

FE6B935608854DC0AB149227E4E646D1.description: Developing Skilled Readers and Building Reading Stamina

4CFD9A7E74A24B779BF766BA1238A130.description:
Read grade-level high-frequency words, including decodable and irregular words, with
automaticity and accuracy.

89EC67646FB4481EADCE02FBD2A4AFCC.description: Use knowledge of affixes (e.g., suffixes, prefixes) to decode and encode words.

40205792E94C46B7867A49876037219A.description: Use knowledge of syllabication and syllable types to decode and encode words.

84B0F4B0619A4A1C9DDDF63BE02C8B55.description: Decode and encode words with vowel teams and r-controlled vowels.

D2D2992550A94BFDA2B72EEE0902AA49.description:
Phonics and Word Recognition: The student will apply grade level phonics and
word analysis skills to decode (read) unfamiliar words in grade level text.

83E6CBF4D7A9409EA795DC2E1198DBF6.description:
See Kindergarten through grade two for standards that address Phonological and
Phonemic Awareness.

E15AF346F60143EF89F961D288357C1A.description: See Kindergarten for standards that address Print Concepts.
